entry.title: Sanjo Ohashi・三条大橋
entry.content:
The Sanjo Bridge over the Kamo River in eastern Kyoto.

This bridge has existed since at least the 16th century, and is depicted in the last of Hiroshige’s 53 Stations of the Tokaido series of woodblock prints from 1833.

entry.title: Hojo & Garden・方丈と庭園
entry.content:
Raining today, so I sat in the main hall (Hojo) to enjoy the Sosenchi Garden at Tenryu-ji Temple.

Kyoto is no longer empty as it was in April, but since Japan is essentially closed to all foreigners there are a much more reasonable number of tourists around. The people that would have been in this photo were removed by careful framing and timing... and Photoshop ;-)

entry.title: Fireflies・蛍
entry.content:
Fireflies this evening in the mountains of southwest Kameoka - west of Kyoto, north of Osaka.

It was really hard to shoot this, it was so dark. My camera’s electronic viewfinder was completely black. The environment was destroyed any time a car came close, which wasn't very often, forunately. This is several long exposures, shot on a tripod, at high ISO speeds, composited together.

entry.title: Zuboraya・づぼらや
entry.content:
The giant pufferfish floating about Zuboraya, a famous fugu restaurant in Osaka’s Shinsekai district; recently closed, a casualty of the Coronavirus.

As Japan reopens and gets back to normal - or what will be normal for quite a while - I’m noticing that numerous shops are missing, replaced by signs that say “For Rent.” I’m sure this is happening everywhere else, as well.
